sen.e: Motoie JIMYOIN (1132-April 7, 1214) was a Court noble from the late Heian period till the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 平頼盛の娘を妻とし、守貞親王の乳母人となってその養育に当たっていたが、寿永2年（1183年）に守貞親王が伊勢平氏一門に伴われて都落ちした際には供奉せず都に留まる。
sen.e: He married a daughter of TAIRA no Yorimori and nurtured Imperial Prince Morisada as nursing mother's family, but when Imperial Prince Morisada fled from Kyoto accompanied by Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) family, he remained in Kyoto instead of accompanying him.

sen.cmt: Kyoto の後のスペース短縮

sen.j: 程なくして、源義仲上京による政治的混乱を避けるため、舅の頼盛や甥の一条能保の後を追って関東に亡命した。
sen.e: In order to escape the political upheaval arising from MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka's entrance into Kyoto, he soon left Kyoto in exile to Kanto region following Yorimori, his father-in-law and Yoshiyasu ICHIJYO, his nephew.

sen.j: 義仲、平家が滅亡した後には再度都に戻り、妻とともに西海から戻った守貞親王に再び仕える。
sen.e: After the fall of Yoshinaka and the Heike family, he came back to Kyoto and served Imperial Prince Morisada who returned from the Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast) with his wife.
sen.cmt: 「妻」というのは、状況からして、基家の妻と解釈し、「with his wife」（西海から親王と共に帰ってきた）としました。

sen.e: He gave Jimyo-in Temple to Imperial Prince Morisada for his residence and made his daughter Nobuko Princess.

sen.e: In 1221 after the Jokyu War, Emperor Chukyo was dethroned and Imperial Prince Yutahito who Nobuko gave birth to ascended the throne as Emperor Gohorikawa.
